item.title: Teaching
item.description:
I teach the following courses at the Department of Business and IT, University of South-Eastern Norway (USN).

  • 6118N : eForretning og sosiale medier

I teach the following courses at the Department of Informatics, University of Oslo. All my courses have official course websites which you can navigate by clicking on the course codes, starting with IN.

  • IN5150 : Recent Advancements in Internet Protocols; also Ph.D. clone IN9150
  • IN3230 : Networks; also master clone IN4230

Past courses

I was the course coordinator and teaching assistant for INF1060 : introduction to operating systems and data communications course from 2013 - 2016 at the Dept. of Informatics, Univ. of Oslo.

I also taught courses such as Computer Networks, Wireless Communication and Programming Languages at the Department of Computer Science, Daffodil International University, Bangladesh.

item.title: Supervision
item.description:
Currently, I’m supervising five master theses:

  • Tobias Fladby: Managing Real-Time Video and Data Flows with Coupled Congestion Control Mechanism
  • Erlend Hapnes: Can we control a TCP path?
  • Naima Noor: (together with Professor Michael Welzl) - On the Predictability of the Deployment of Network Mechanisms
  • Christoffer Bjelke, Andreas Limi: Timer-based TCP (TBTCP)
  • Maximilian von Stephanides: Improving Internet Congestion Control with Packet Loss Prediction using Machine Learning

Past master students

I supervised the following master students:

  • Kristian Andreas Hiorth, together with Professor Michael Welzl, TCP-in-UDP: Enabling gradually deployable TCP coupled congestion control using an efficient UDP encapsulation

I also provided unofficial support/supervision to the following students:

  • Ã˜ystein Dale , under EU NEAT project.
  • Fredrik Haugseth , under EU NEAT project.
  • Lepe Khanum , worked on Fling measurement tool
